inference:
South American stamps issued before the 70s are Brazil and Peru.
Brazil stamps in the 50s cost 3 cents each.
Brazil stamps in the 60s cost 6 cents each.
Peru stamps in the 50s cost 4 cents each.
Peru stamps in the 60s cost 7 cents each.
The number of Brazil stamps in the 50s is 3.
The number of Brazil stamps in the 60s is 6.
The number of Peru stamps in the 50s is 4.
The number of Peru stamps in the 60s is 7.
Total cost of Brazil stamps in the 50s is $3 \times 3 = 9$ cents.
Total cost of Brazil stamps in the 60s is $6 \times 6 = 36$ cents.
Total cost of Peru stamps in the 50s is $4 \times 4 = 16$ cents.
Total cost of Peru stamps in the 60s is $7 \times 7 = 49$ cents.
Total cost of South American stamps issued before the 70s is $9 + 36 + 16 + 49 = 110$ cents.
$110$ cents = $1.10$ dollars.
Final Answer: $\boxed{$1.10}$
ground_truth: His South American stamps issued before the $70\text{'s}$ include $4+7=11$ from Brazil that cost $11 \times \$ 0.06 = \$ 0.66$ and $6+4=10$ from Peru that cost $10 \times \$0.04 = \$0.40.$ Their total cost is $ \$ 0.66 + \$ 0.40 = \boxed{\$ 1.06}.$
